Articles.Content:
Hey all,

Rather than try to describe my problem, I have an image of it: (that sounded better in my head)

The red oval shows where the radial attachment doesn't have a green attach point like it should. I've run into this before and I don't think any of my mods are causing the problem since it does the same thing in the base unmod version. I've tried saving the storage container part as a subassembly but it doesn't help. I've also tried this with other things such as tanks with the same result. Is this just a bug in the editor or is there a trick to making it stick?

Edited January 29, 2014 by Rabid_Monkey
Answered

That's normal. I assume that you built the parts in red starting with the Hitchhiker? If you want to save it as a subassembly, the radial attachment port has to be its root part. SelectRoot is invaluable for such occasions
That has happened to me too many times, and it's very annoying. Why is it as it is? Does it have to be this way?

That's normal. I assume that you built the parts in red starting with the Hitchhiker? If you want to save it as a subassembly, the radial attachment port has to be its root part. SelectRoot is invaluable for such occasions

You, sir, are a steely-eyed missile-man. That did the trick, thanks!
The game assumes you're going to reattach it with the same node that you originally disconnected. The feature you're looking for is simply not yet implemented.
